Kristinn Sigurdsson wrote:

> Hi all,
>  
> As is common knowledge, Heritrix's aggressive link extraction methods 
> lead to a large number of 404 errors. Generally we've simple accepted 
> this and believed it to be of fairly little consequnce.
>  
> However, this morning I got an e-mail from an irate webmaster 
> complaining about this behavior. It seems that he gets an e-mail for 
> every 404 error that occurs. He explained that this was due to a 
> recent restructuring of the web, they were keeping an eye out for 
> stray dead links that might still exist. Heritrix swamped his Inbox 
> with 18.000 e-mails over the course a few days.

Sounds like he has a few links to fix (smile).

>  
> I'm not sure that there is anything we can do about this, but I 
> thought I would share this here.

There is an extant RFE for putting an 'aggression tuner' on extractors 
('[ 913002 ] Extractor aggressiveness needs to be configurable' 
http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=913002&group_id=73833&atid=539102).  
We should have a go at implementing it.

St.Ack

>  
> - Kris
>
